object.name: Air Bubble
object.notes: A stationary bubble that replenishes air when collected underwater. Can be collected by the Orange Luma in SMG2. A bubble that restores the player's air when collected underwater.

object.name: Air Bubble Generator
object.notes: A nozzle that periodically generates several air bubbles that replenish the player's air when underwater. A nozzle that periodically generates air bubbles.

field.name: Delay
field.notes: Time between bubble spawns in frames.

field.name: Duration
field.notes: Life duration of a single bubble in frames.

object.name: Clockwork Ruins -- Luma Cage
object.notes: Stationary object that will disappear once its SW_B gets triggered. Plays the "Open" animation and destroys itself after that. Plays a short cutscene using a special camera. The red metal cage from Clockwork Ruins Galaxy.

object.name: Cosmic Cove -- 2D Underwater Planet

object.name: Cosmic Cove -- 2D Sea Mine Plant
object.notes: The large planet found in Cosmic Cove Galaxy's 2D section that features Jammyfish and Sea Mines.

object.name: Cosmic Cove -- Moving Water Cube
object.notes: A cube-shaped body of water from Cosmic Cove Galaxy.

object.name: Collision Movement Area
object.notes: Moves compatible objects inside this area if they are bound to a floor triangle with the collision type AreaMove. Compatible objects are the player itself, BombBird and its bombs, Kuribo, Karon and CocoNut. Moves compatible objects if they are on AreaMove collision triangles.

field.name: Speed
field.notes: Sets the movement speed.

object.name: Arrow Sign
object.notes: A large arrow-shaped sign with a red outline.

object.name: Arrow Switch
object.notes: A rotating switch object that can be activated using Spin Attacks. An arrow-shaped switch that rotates once it gets triggered.

field.name: Rotation Direction
field.values: -1 = 180° to right or left, 0 = 90° to left, 1 = 90° to right, 2 = 180° to left, 3 = 180° to right
field.notes: Specifies the rotation when hit.

field.name: Activation Mode
field.notes: If enabled, it cannot be hit again util the SW_A event deactivates again.

field.name: Shadow Length
field.notes: Sets shadow drop length.

object.name: Blue Space Junk Block
object.notes: Remains at a resting position that can be defined by linking a GeneralPos with the name 合体ブロック故郷点 to it. Once the player gets in its range, it will move to its actual position. This class supports ShapeModelNo models. The timed activation requires additional effect data under the UniqueName "Blur". A square-shaped Space Junk block.

field.name: Activation Range
field.notes: Specifies the activation range to Mario's position. If set to -1, the model's diameter is used instead.

field.name: Activation Time
field.notes: If Obj_arg7 is set, this specifies the timer until the block disappears again.

field.name: Is Timed?
field.notes: If enabled, the block will be activated for a set amount of time only.

object.notes: The interior of the Comet Observatory's Library.

object.name: Bowser Attack Rock (Fight)
object.notes: Usually not visible but they get activated by Bowser's attacks. Once it appears, it falls down onto ground. Then, it becomes a yellow orb that can be smashed into Bowser. Depending on the encounter number, it can also emit shockwaves. A yellow orb that appears during the boss fights against Bowser.

field.name: Bowser Encounter Number
field.notes: If greater than 1, the rock will emit a purple quake wave once it lands.

object.name: Bowser Attack Rock (Final Fight)
object.notes: These are usually not visible until Bowser activates them during the final fight. These fly to their actual position and will remain there. The orb can be smashed into Bowser. A yellow orb that appears during the final boss fight against Bowser.

field.name: First Appearance Delay
field.notes: Delay until the rock appears for the first time.

object.name: Bowser Attack Rock (Stage)
object.notes: A rock that emits from the ground and breaks into a yellow orb. It can be smashed into KoopaSeals. A yellow orb that appears before the fights against Bowser.

object.name: Audio Effect Area
object.notes: Sets the audio effect once entered by the player. For example, this can enable echoes. Enables a different audio effect once entered.

field.name: Effect Type
field.values: 0 = Default, 1 = Underground Echo, 2 = Unused, 3 = Unused, 4 = Fleet Glide, 5 = Fleet Glide, 6 = Unused
field.notes: Specifies which effect configuration to use.

field.name: Priority
field.notes: Priority of the audio effect (unrelated to areas).

object.name: Starship Mario -- Rosalina's Comet
object.notes: The large egg-shaped comet that appears during Starship Mario's ending cutscene.

object.name: Mattermouth
object.notes: A skull that moves around freely or on a set path. It "eats" away parts of objects that are compatible with ClipDrawArea. This enemy cannot be defeated in any way. Can be frozen by the Orange Luma in SMG2. A gluttonous skull enemy from Haunty Halls Galaxy.

object.name: Haunty Halls -- Small Rotating Carpet Platform
Lava Lair -- Mattermouth Carpet
object.notes: The large carpet from Bowser's Lava Lair that is eaten away by Mattermouths.

object.name: Porcupuffer
object.notes: A blowfish enemy that inflates once Mario gets in its range. It will then home on to Mario and explode after a certain amount of time. Can be frozen by the Orange Luma in SMG2. A purple blowfish enemy from Drip Drop Galaxy and Cosmic Cove Galaxy.

object.name: Blimp Fruit
object.notes: A fruit that, when eaten, transforms Yoshi into Blimp Yoshi. Can be targeted by the Orange Luma to make it swing. Can be temporarily destroyed using Koopa Shells or Ground Pounds. The blue fruit that Yoshi can eat to expand and fly like a balloon.

object.name: Generic Star Ball Opener
object.notes: If Mario rides a Star Ball and touches this object's center, it will pull the Star Ball towards the center. Then, the Star Ball will be cracked open. A metal hole with a blue edge that is used to crack Star Balls in Rolling Greens Galaxy and Rolling Gizmo Galaxy.

object.name: Rolling Coaster -- Star Ball Opener
object.notes: If Mario rides a Star Ball and touches this object's center, it will pull the Star Ball towards the center. Then, the Star Ball will be cracked open. The round planet from Rolling Coaster Galaxy that features a hole to crack open the Star Ball.

object.name: Rolling Masterpiece -- Star Ball Opener
object.notes: If Mario rides a Star Ball and touches this object's center, it will pull the Star Ball towards the center. Then, the Star Ball will be cracked open. A pink pencil platform from Rolling Masterpiece Galaxy that features a hole to crack open the Star Ball.

object.name: Star Ball Rail
object.notes: An invisible rail for the Star Ball. The Star Ball will automatically start to move along the path once it touches the path's beginning. An invisible path that the Star Ball will move on once touched.

field.name: Acceleration
field.notes: Acceleration value multiplied by 1000. Default is 1500.

field.name: Deceleration
field.notes: Deceleration value multiplied by 1000. Default is 995.

field.name: Range
field.notes: Active distance from player's position.

field.name: Hide during intro
field.notes: The air won't appear during the into if enabled.

field.name: Always active?
field.notes: Always active if enabled.

object.name: Swooper
object.notes: A flying bat enemy. These enemies may be flying around passively, move on a path or hang from ceilings. It will fly towards Mario if he comes in their range. They will fly towards Mario to attack him. The icy variant (BasaBasaIce) will freeze Mario if touched, provided that Mario is not using the Ice power-up. It can be defeated using Spin Attacks, Stomping and most other attacks. It can be stunned by shooting Star Bits at them. The icy variant (BasaBasaIce) can be attacked if the player is not using the Ice power-up. Can be targeted by the Orange Luma in SMG2. A bat enemy that is mostly found in cave sections.

field.name: Detection Range
field.notes: Range in which it will detect the player. Default is 2000.

field.name: Attacking Range
field.notes: Range in which it will attack the player. Default is Detection Range + 1000.

object.name: Ice Swooper
object.notes: A flying bat enemy. These enemies may be flying around passively, move on a path or hang from ceilings. It will fly towards Mario if he comes in their range. They will fly towards Mario to attack him. The icy variant (BasaBasaIce) will freeze Mario if touched, provided that Mario is not using the Ice power-up. It can be defeated using Spin Attacks, Stomping and most other attacks. It can be stunned by shooting Star Bits at them. The icy variant (BasaBasaIce) can be attacked if the player is not using the Ice power-up. Can be targeted by the Orange Luma in SMG2. An icy Swooper that can freeze the player upon contact. Can be defeated using Ice Mario's attacks or the Invincibility power-up.

field.name: Detection Range
field.notes: Range in which it will detect the player. Default is 2000.

field.name: Attacking Range
field.notes: Range in which it will attack the player. Default is Detection Range + 1000.

object.name: Whomp
object.notes: A stone block enemy that moves on a fixed path. Once it sees Mario, it will move towards him to fall down on him. Once it lies on the ground, the weak point on its back can be Ground Pounded. Can be frozen by the Orange Luma. It will spawn 7 Star Bits if defeated. A large rectangular stone block enemy that can attack by falling onto the player.

field.name: Movement Speed
field.notes: Defines the movement speed, multiplied by 1000. Default is 600.

field.name: Attacking Range
field.notes: The range in which it will fall down onto the ground after detecting Mario.

field.name: Spawn no Star Bits?
field.notes: If enabled, it won't spawn any Star Bits after being defeated.

object.name: Whomp King
object.notes: A large stone block boss. It can summon Whimps that will try to attack Mario like Whomps do. The boss itself can defeat those smaller blocks by crushing them. Like its smaller counterparts, this boss will try to fall onto Mario to attack him. It can also attack using shockwaves that appear when he jumps. When he's lying on ground, Mario can Ground Pound the weak spot on its back to damage it. After hitting the boss three times, he will be defeated. It always spawns a Power Star. It uses two GeneralPos. バッタンキング基準位置 is used as his position after the battle. マリオ位置 is used to position Mario after the battle. Several messages are also required. BattanKing000 specifies the introduction text. BattanKing001 specifies the text after defeating him. Lastly, the actual cutscenes have to be specified as well: バッタンキング登場 for the opening and バッタンキングダウン for the outro. The large stone block boss from Throwback Galaxy.

field.name: Camera Register Starting Index
field.notes: Specifies the starting index of the camera vector register. Occupies two cameras.

The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv). A decorative asteroid belt that can be seen in the background of Battle Belt Galaxy.

object.name: Floating Debris (Bricks)

object.name: Warp Pipe
object.notes: A Warp Pipe that can transport the player to another Warp Pipe instance. However, it also supports various other modes and functions unrelated to transportation. Warp Pipes that are placed in WhiteSnowGalaxy have a hardcoded clipping range of 1000. The iconic pipe used to warp Mario/Luigi from one place to another. Cannot be entered until SW_A is activated. (optional) Activates SW_B when Mario exits the pipe. (optional)

field.name: Exit Force (Forwards)
field.notes: The force to push Mario forwards when exiting the pipe. Default 5.

field.name: Exit Force (Upwards)
field.notes: The force to push Mario upwards when exiting the pipe. Default 25.

field.name: Mode
field.values: -1 = Entrance and exit, 1 = Exit only, 2 = Hidden until first exited, 3 = Eject without warping, 4 = Eject without warping (spawns Coins), 5 = Eject without warping (spawns Star Bits), 6 = Hide when exited
field.notes: The pipe's behavior after being entered.

field.name: Connection ID
field.notes: Set two pipes to have the same number to link them together.

field.name: Music Change
field.notes: Index of the music to change to once the pipe is left.

field.name: Music State
field.notes: The state of the music that plays after exiting the pipe.

field.name: Ignore Gravity
field.notes: If enabled, the rotation of the pipe will not be affected by gravity.

field.name: Color Frame
field.notes: The animation frame to use as the pipe's color.

object.name: Warp Pipe (Underwater)
object.notes: A Warp Pipe that can transport the player to another Warp Pipe instance. However, it also supports various other modes and functions unrelated to transportation. Warp Pipes that are placed in WhiteSnowGalaxy have a hardcoded clipping range of 1000. A Warp Pipe used for underwater locations; can inhale the player by setting an SW_A trigger.

field.name: Exit Force (Forwards)
field.notes: The force to push Mario forwards when exiting the pipe. Default 5.

field.name: Exit Force (Upwards)
field.notes: The force to push Mario upwards when exiting the pipe. Default 25.

field.name: Mode
field.values: -1 = Entrance and exit, 1 = Exit only, 2 = Hidden until first exited, 3 = Eject without warping, 4 = Eject without warping (spawns Coins), 5 = Eject without warping (spawns Star Bits), 6 = Hide when exited
field.notes: The pipe's behavior after being entered.

field.name: Connection ID
field.notes: Set two pipes to have the same number to link them together.

field.name: Music Change
field.notes: Index of the music to change to once the pipe is left.

field.name: Music State
field.notes: The state of the music that plays after exiting the pipe.

field.name: Ignore Gravity
field.notes: If enabled, the rotation of the pipe will not be affected by gravity.

field.name: Color Frame
field.notes: The animation frame to use as the pipe's color.

object.name: Upside Dizzy: Gravity Wall (Gravity-Changing Planet)
object.notes: The gravity wall used on the ending planet of Upside Dizzy Galaxy.

object.name: Green Star
object.notes: A green Power Star that appears after collecting 120 Stars.

object.name: Group Switch Controller
object.notes: A controller that activates something via SW_A if all the connected switches are activated. The input value starts at the number defined in SW_B. (Example: If switch 44 should be activated, and there are four connected switches starting from 40, you set SW_A to 44, SW_B to 40 and obj_arg0 to 4.)

object.name: Honeyhive: Sky Model
object.notes: The sky model used in Honeyhive Galaxy.

object.name: Hammer Bro

object.notes: A big black Piranha Plant with spikes on its head and body. It can only defeated with another object, such as a Stretch Plant or a Rainbow Star.

object.name: Puzzle Plank: Mandibug Puzzle (Piece B)

field.name: Homing Activation Range
field.notes: Default 2000.

field.name: Turn Speed Multiplier
field.notes: Default 1.

field.name: Bullet Count
field.notes: Default 1.

field.name: Launch Delay
field.notes: Default 180.

field.name: Bullet Lifetime
field.notes: Default 600.

field.name: Binder Activation delay
field.notes: Default 35.

object.name: Bee

object.notes: Her highness, the queen of the bees.

object.name: Puzzle Plank: Starting Planet
object.notes: The planet used at the start of Puzzle Plank Galaxy.

object.name: Clockwork Ruins: Rotating Platform (Version A)
object.notes: A rotating platform used on the hammer planet in Clockwork Ruins Galaxy.

object.name: Clockwork Ruins: Rotating Platform (Version B)
object.notes: A rotating platform used on the hammer planet in Clockwork Ruins Galaxy.

object.name: Broken Glass Effect

object.name: Shiverburn: Skating Planet
object.notes: The third planet in the first mission of Shiverburn Galaxy.

object.name: Shiverburn: Skating Planet (Ice Layer)
object.notes: A generic map object with a model and collision. It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv). The layer of ice used on the skating planet in Shiverburn Galaxy.

field.name: Color Frame
field.notes: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.

field.name: Texture Frame
field.notes: If TexChange.btp exists, this will define the texture frame to be used.

field.name: Shadow Length
field.notes: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.

object.name: Li'l Brr
object.notes: An enemy that can damage the player upon contact. Can be stunned with a Spin Attack which reveals its core. The core can be destroyed by most of Mario's actions. A burning rock enemy that floats around and chases after Mario. It will freeze the player upon contact.

field.name: Appearance
field.notes: Initial nerve state.

field.name: Respawn
field.notes: Keeps respawning after killing if enabled.

object.name: Falling Ice Crystal
object.notes: A falling ice crystal used on the skating planet of Shiverburn Galaxy.

object.name: Stalagmite
object.notes: A stalagmite that can be destroyed with a spin.

object.notes: A clone version of Mario that copies the player's movements. (This object crashes the game if used.)

object.name: Invisible Wall (Size: 10 x 10)

object.notes: A disk planet used near the end of the first mission of Sky Station Galaxy.

object.name: ? Block (Switch)

object.name: Starship Mario: Power-Up Display Room Door

object.name: Rolling Masterpiece: Star Ball Launcher (Paintbrush Planet)

object.name: Rolling Masterpiece: Star Ball Launcher (Disk Planet)
object.notes: A hole that launches the Star Ball along a path.

object.name: Ground Pound Spring (Automatic)

object.name: Magikoopa (Small Goombas)
object.notes: A Magikoopa that shoots small Goombas. It can be put on a path.

object.name: Magikoopa (Li'l Cinders)

object.name: Dry Bones
object.notes: The skeleton of a Koopa enemy. Interacts with MoveLimit.kcl

object.name: Key

object.notes: A small rock that will spawn either a coin or a Star Bit when kicked.

The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv). The large portal that Bowser disappears through during the intro sequence at Peach's Castle.

field.name: Color Frame

object.notes: A generic map object with a model and collision. It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv). object.name: Yellow Moving Platform
object.notes: A thin yellow moving platform used in Bowser Jr.'s Fearsome Fleet. It requires paths. The following set of parameters is required: - GroupId same as parent's - SW_AWAKE must be equal to parent's SW_A switch - SW_B equal for both objects.

object.name: Yellow Moving Platform Generator Controller
object.notes: This object does additional controling of the platforms from Bowser Jr.'s Fearsome Fleet. This object is connected to its parent KoopaJrLv2LiftGenerator object using the GroupId and GeneratorId (l_id of parent) settings. Additionally, this object requires paths.

object.name: Yellow Moving Platform Generator
object.notes: This object controls the generation of platforms from Bowser Jr.'s Fearsome Fleet. It requires a unique set of l_id, GroupId, SW_A and SW_B settings, as well as grouped KoopaJrLv2LiftForGenerator and KoopaJrLv2Lift objects. See their descriptions for more information.

object.name: Jr.'s Fearsome Fleet: Starting Platforms
object.notes: The set of platforms used at the start of Bowser Jr.'s Fearsome Fleet.

object.name: Jr.'s Fearsome Fleet: Checkpoint Platform
object.notes: A single platform used near the checkpoint of Bowser Jr.'s Fearsome Fleet.

object.notes: The sky model used in Bowser Jr.'s Boom Bunker.

object.name: Jr.'s Boom Bunker: Starting Planet
object.notes: The planet used at the start of Bowser Jr.'s Boom Bunker.

object.name: Bowser's Gravity Gauntlet: Moving Platform

object.name: Chance Cube (Starship Mario)
object.notes: A special dice cube used in the bonus room on Starship Mario; can reward Mario/Luigi with a Star Bit, a 1-Up, a 3-Up or a 5-Up.

object.name: Starship Mario: Bonus Room
object.notes: The bonus room with two chance cube Luma Shops used on Starship Mario.

object.name: Luigi (Playable Character)
object.notes: The younger brother of Mario that helps him in his adventure to rescue the Princess. Used in several galaxies as a playable character.

object.name: Mario Squared: Yellow Tile
object.notes: A yellow tile platform used on the Luigi planet in Mario Squared Galaxy.

object.name: Luigi (Starship Mario)
object.notes: The younger brother of Mario that appears on Starship Mario during World 3; tells Mario that he will appear in certain galaxies to help him.

object.name: Shiverburn: Starting Planet (Ice Version)
object.notes: An icy version of the planet used at the start of Shiverburn Galaxy.

object.name: Shiverburn: Starting Planet (Fire Version)
object.notes: A fire version of the planet used at the start of Shiverburn Galaxy.

object.name: Shiverburn: Stone Rock (Version A)
object.notes: A large stone rock used in Shiverburn Galaxy.

object.name: Shiverburn: Stone Rock (Version B)
object.notes: A large stone rock used in Shiverburn Galaxy.

object.name: Shiverburn: Stone Rock (Version C)
object.notes: A large stone rock used in Shiverburn Galaxy.

object.name: Shiverburn: Stone Rock (Version D)
object.notes: A large stone rock used in Shiverburn Galaxy.

object.name: Shiverburn: Lava Meteor
object.notes: A lava meteor used on the skating planet in Shiverburn Galaxy.

object.name: Melty Monster: Lava Planet (Large)

object.name: Melty Monster: Lava Planet (Small)
object.notes: A small lava-covered planet used in Melty Monster Galaxy.

object.name: Melty Monster: Pole (Blue)
object.notes: A generic map object with a model and collision. It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv). A blue pole used on the second planet of the first mission of Melty Monster Galaxy.

field.name: Color Frame
field.notes: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.

field.name: Texture Frame
field.notes: If TexChange.btp exists, this will define the texture frame to be used.

field.name: Shadow Length
field.notes: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.

object.name: Melty Monster: Sky Model

object.name: Melty Monster: Stone Planet (Magmaarghs Planet)

object.name: Lava Wave
object.notes:
A single lava wave that loops along an assigned path at a customizable speed*. Used on Melty Molten Galaxy.
* Speed is set only on obj_arg0 and applies to the entire path, the "Speed" path point arg is ignored.

object.notes: A set of rotating platforms used on the lava platforms planet in Shiverburn Galaxy.

object.name: Shiverburn: Rotating Platforms C (Lava Platforms Planet)
object.notes: A set of rotating platforms used on the lava platforms planet in Shiverburn Galaxy.

object.name: Shiverburn: Rotating Platforms D (Lava Platforms Planet)
object.notes: A set of rotating platforms used on the lava platforms planet in Shiverburn Galaxy.

object.name: Shiverburn: Rotating Platforms E (Lava Platforms Planet)
object.notes: A set of rotating platforms used on the lava platforms planet in Shiverburn Galaxy.

object.notes: A set of rotating platforms used on the lava platforms planet in Shiverburn Galaxy.

object.notes: A set of rotating platforms used on the lava platforms planet in Shiverburn Galaxy.

object.name: Shiverburn: Rotating Platforms H (Lava Platforms Planet)
object.notes: A set of rotating platforms used on the lava platforms planet in Shiverburn Galaxy.

object.name: Banzai Bill
object.notes: A larger version of a Bullet Bill.

field.name: Homing Activation Range
field.notes: Default 2000.

field.name: Turn Speed Multiplier
field.notes: Default 1.

field.name: Bullet Count
field.notes: Default 1.

field.name: Launch Delay
field.notes: Default 180.

field.name: Bullet Lifetime
field.notes: Default 600.

field.name: Binder Activation delay
field.notes: Default 35.

object.name: The Chimp (Skating Challenge)
object.notes: The Chimp used for the skating challenges in both Freezy Flake Galaxy and Shiverburn Galaxy.

object.name: Freezy Flake: Skate Challenge Controller
object.notes: A controller used to control The Chimp's skating challenge in Freezy Flake Galaxy.

object.name: Shiverburn: Skate Challenge Controller
object.notes: A controller used to control The Chimp's skating challenge in Shiverburn Galaxy.

object.name: Underwater Plant
object.notes: A decorative plant for underwater sections. Must have ShapeModelNo set to 0 to be visible.

object.name: Spawn Point
object.notes: Sets the spawn point for Mario/Luigi at the start of a mission or at Checkpoints in a mission.

object.name: Spawn Point Controller (Grand Star Return Position)
object.notes: A controller that sets the spawn point of Mario/Luigi on Starship Mario after they collect a Grand Star.

object.name: Starship Mario: Fruit Planet
object.notes: A small disk-shaped planet containing fruit; used on Starship Mario.

object.name: Starship Mario: Starting Planet (Before Transformation)
object.notes: The planet used as Starship Mario before it is transformed by Lubba.

object.name: Starship Flying Cutscene Controller
object.notes: A controller for the Starship taking-off cutscene.

object.name: Starship Mario: Chimney
object.notes: A generic map object with a model and collision. It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv). The chimney used on Starship Mario.

field.notes: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.

field.name: Texture Frame

object.notes: A generic map object with a model and collision. It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv). A rocket booster used on the back of Starship Mario.

field.notes: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.

object.notes: The planet used as Starship Mario.

object.name: Starship Mario: Ship Core
object.notes: A generic map object with a model and collision. It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv). The blue core used in the power-up display room of Starship Mario.

field.notes: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.

object.notes: The steering wheel used on Starship Mario.

object.name: Jr.'s Boom Bunker: Cannon Target (Hammer Bros. Planet)
object.notes: A target for a cannon used on the Hammer Bros. planet in Bowser Jr.'s Boom Bunker.

object.name: Jr.'s Boom Bunker: Cannon Target (Cloud Ferris Wheel Planet)
object.notes: A target for a cannon used on the cloud ferris wheel planet in Bowser Jr.'s Boom Bunker.

object.name: Jr.'s Boom Bunker: Cannon Target (Dark Matter Planet)
object.notes: A target for a cannon used on the dark matter planet in Bowser Jr.'s Boom Bunker.

object.name: No Hat Area
object.notes: An area that, when entered, causes Mario/Luigi to lose his cap.

object.name: Mecha-Koopa
object.notes: A small robotic version of a Koopa that can be defeated by ground pounding it.

object.name: Bowser Cutscene Controller (Prologue)
object.notes: A controller used to trigger the Bowser cutscene in the prologue.

object.name: Lubba
object.notes: The large purple Luma that helps the player throughout their adventure in Super Mario Galaxy 2.

object.name: Flash Black: Mansion Door
object.notes: The door of the mansion used at the start of Flash-Black Galaxy. Use SW_A to close the door.

object.name: Flash Black: Sky Model
object.notes: The sky model used in Flash Black Galaxy.

object.name: Flash Black: Silver Star Platforms
object.notes: The planet where the Silver Stars are located in the first mission of Flash Black Galaxy.

object.name: Flash Black: Starting Planet
object.notes: The planet used at the start of Flash Black Galaxy.

object.name: Skeeter
object.notes: A purple spider that lunges across water.

object.name: Li'l Cinder
object.notes: An enemy that can damage the player upon contact. Can be stunned with a Spin Attack which reveals its core. The core can be destroyed by most of Mario's actions. A burning rock enemy that floats around and chases after Mario. It will burn the player upon contact. If attacked with a Fire Ball, it gets reignited.

field.name: Appearance
field.notes: Initial nerve state.

field.name: Respawn
field.notes: Keeps respawning after killing if enabled.

object.name: Mercator Projection Area (Cube)
object.notes: Any object and its paths that are placed inside this area are projected around the origin of the zone. Only a limited amount of objects can be projected, objects that extend the classes MercatorFixParts, MercatorRailMoveParts and MercatorRotateParts are known to work with this. Note that the object OceanSmallTurtle requires mercator projection. This object is useless in SMG2. This object ignores the AreaShapeNo setting.

object.name: Message Area
object.notes: This area is used as a text trigger in various places.

object.name: Goombeetle
object.notes: A Goomba with a helmet on its head.

object.name: Meteor (Gateway)
object.notes: A small meteor used in Gateway Galaxy. This will cause a quake once it hits the floor.

object.name: Meteor
object.notes: A meteor used in several galaxies, including Melty Molten Galaxy (SMG1) and Hightail Falls Galaxy (SMG2).

object.name: Meteor Spawner
object.notes:
A spawn point used for meteors.
Warning: These will crash the game if they hit the ground.

object.name: Space Junk: Sky Model
object.notes: The sky model used in Space Junk Galaxy.

object.name: Yoshi-Star: Grass Bonus Planet
object.notes: An optional planet used in the second planet of Yoshi-Star Galaxy.

object.name: Yoshi-Star: Mist Effect (Grass Bonus Planet)
object.notes: A mist-like effect used on the grass bonus planet in Yoshi-Star Galaxy.

object.name: Reflection Area
object.notes: Used for reflection models, but these don't exist in SMG2 anymore. Thus, this object is pretty much useless.

object.name: Whittle
object.notes: A wood NPC who appears in Puzzle Plank Galaxy and Tall Trunk Galaxy.

object.name: Undergrunt
object.notes: A mole enemy with a helmet that moves on a path.

object.name: Pianta
object.notes: A Pianta used in Starshine Beach Galaxy.

object.name: Starshine Beach: Pianta Statue
object.notes: The large Pianta statue used in Starshine Beach Galaxy.

object.name: Starship Mario: Bee Mushroom (Display Room)
object.notes: A Bee Mushroom used in the power-up display room of Starship Mario.

object.name: Starship Mario: Cloud Flower (Display Room)
object.notes: A Cloud Flower used in the power-up display room of Starship Mario.

object.name: Starship Mario: Spin Drill (Display Room)
object.notes: A Spin Drill used in the power-up display room of Starship Mario.

object.name: Starship Mario: Fire Flower (Display Room)
object.notes: A Fire Flower used in the power-up display room of Starship Mario.

object.name: Starship Mario: Spring Mushroom (Display Room)
object.notes: A Spring Mushroom used in the power-up display room of Starship Mario.

object.name: Starship Mario: Rock Mushroom (Display Room)
object.notes: A Rock Mushroom used in the power-up display room of Starship Mario.

object.name: Starship Mario: Boo Mushroom (Display Room)
object.notes: A Boo Mushroom used in the power-up display room of Starship Mario.

object.name: Bee Mushroom
object.notes: A Bee Mushroom used to transform Mario/Luigi into a flying bee.

object.name: Fire Flower
object.notes: A Fire Flower allows Mario/Luigi to shoot fire balls.

object.name: Spring Mushroom
object.notes: A Spring Mushroom that allows Mario/Luigi to bounce into the air by pressing A with perfect timing.

object.name: Boo Mushroom
object.notes: A Boo Mushroom transforms Mario/Luigi into a Boo, allowing him to float in the air and go through certain walls.

object.name: Rock Mushroom
object.notes: A Rock Mushroom that transforms the player into a rock, allowing them to roll into walls and enemies.

object.name: Power-Up Switch Area
object.notes: Activates the switch that is assigned to its SW_A setting when the required condition is met.

object.name: The Chimp's Gummit Challenge Room
object.notes: The planet where The Chimp is located in both Freezy Flake Galaxy and Shiverburn Galaxy.

object.name: Sweet Mystery: Starting Planet

object.name: Sweet Mystery: Comet Medal Platforms
object.notes: A set of platforms where the Comet Medal is located in Sweet Mystery Galaxy.

object.name: Sweet Mystery: Background Food Objects (Donuts)
object.notes: A generic map object with a model and collision. It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv). A set of donuts used in the background of Sweet Mystery Galaxy.

field.notes: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.

field.name: Texture Frame

field.notes: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.

object.notes: A generic map object with a model and collision. It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv). A set of candy canes used in the background of Sweet Mystery Galaxy.

field.notes: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.

object.notes: A set of platforms used in the flipswitch panel section of Sweet Mystery Galaxy.

object.name: Sweet Mystery: Soild Platforms (Section B)
object.notes: The solid platforms used in the flipswitch panel section of Sweet Mystery Galaxy.

object.notes: An invisible cake that can lit-up with the Bulb Berry power-up; used in Sweet Mystery Galaxy.

object.notes: The solid platforms used on the cake planet in Sweet Mystery Galaxy.

object.name: Sweet Mystery: Straw Platform
object.notes: A platform made of straws; used on the cake planet in Sweet Mystery Galaxy.

object.notes: A blue present-box platform used in Sweet Mystery Galaxy. (This object requires a path to move.)

object.notes: A yellow present box platform used in Sweet Mystery Galaxy. (This object requires a path to move.)

object.notes: An invisible brown chocolate platform used in Sweet Mystery Galaxy; can appear when Yoshi eats a Bulb Berry power-up. (This object requires paths to move.)

object.name: Spike Trap (Ground)
object.notes: A platform with spikes that pop out periodically.

object.name: Spike Trap (Wall)
object.notes: A wall with spikes that pop out periodically.

object.name: Puzzle Plank: Bugaboom Planet
object.notes: The planet where Bugaboom is fought in Puzzle Plank Galaxy.

object.notes: The first section of the planet used at the start of Stone Cyclone Galaxy.

object.name: Stone Cyclone: Starting Planet (Section B)
object.notes: The second section of the planet used at the start of Stone Cyclone Galaxy.

object.name: Kleptoad
object.notes: A small blue enemy that likes stealing items; used in Hightail Falls Galaxy. Supported items include: Coins (Coin), Silver Stars (StrayTico), Star Chips (YellowChip/BlueChip), and Air Bubbles (AirBubble).

object.name: Hightail Falls: Kleptoad Planet
object.notes: The planet used in the secret Star mission of Hightail Falls Galaxy.

object.name: Koopa Troopa
object.notes: A standard version of a Koopa Troopa.

object.name: Big Koopa Troopa
object.notes: A supermassive version of a Koopa Troopa; used in Supermassive Galaxy.

object.name: No Message Area
object.notes: An area that, when entered, disables all message boxes.

object.name: No Sleep Area (SMG2)
object.notes:
IMPORTANT: SMG2 only. for SMG1, use NonSleepCube.
A cube-shaped area which prevents the player character from sleeping* while inside it.
* In both games, the player character will begin sleeping on the floor if left unpaused without any actions for a while.

object.name: Ending Cutscene Controller
object.notes: A controller that controls the ending cutscene.

object.name: Rainbow Notes
object.notes: An object which generates rainbow notes which can be collected. Requires SW_APPEAR and SW_A switches. If Obj_arg3 is set to 4, then a valid camera must be associated with the object, or the game will soft-lock.

object.name: Snoodle
object.notes: A plant-like enemy with a green stem intended for underwater levels. Used in Cosmic Cove Galaxy and Slimy Spring Galaxy.

object.name: Water Sphere
object.notes: A sphere of water used in the background of underwater levels.

object.name: Throwback: Starting Planet
object.notes: The planet used at the start of Throwback Galaxy.

object.name: Throwback: Rotating Plank Platform
object.notes: A rotating hexagonal-shaped platform used in Throwback Galaxy.

object.name: Throwback: Wall Ledge Platform
object.notes: A platform that goes in and out of the walls in Throwback Galaxy.

object.name: Throwback: Fortress Cover (Bowser Symbol)
object.notes: The cover used at the top of the starting planet in Throwback Galaxy; features a Bowser symbol.

object.name: Throwback: Fortress Cover (Plain Texture)
object.notes: The fortress cover used at the bottom of the starting planet in Throwback Galaxy; has no symbol on it.

object.name: Flipsville: Sky Model
object.notes: The sky model used in Flipsville Galaxy.

object.name: Tox Box
object.notes: A large stone box that rolls on its sides to follow an assigned path back and forth, crushing anything they roll on top of with any side other than the hollow one.

object.name: Stone Cyclone: Moving Stone Platform
object.notes: A rectangular-shaped stone block used on the cyclone stone planet (Beach Bowl Galaxy) (SMG1) and in Stone Cyclone Galaxy (SMG2). (This object requires paths to move.)

object.name: Stone Cyclone: Rotating Platforms (Long)
object.notes: A pair of long rotating platforms used on the cyclone stone planet (Beach Bowl Galaxy) (SMG1) and in Stone Cyclone Galaxy (SMG2). (This object requires paths to move.)

object.name: Stone Cyclone: Rotating Platforms (Short)
object.notes: A set of three short rotating platforms used on the cyclone stone planet (Beach Bowl Galaxy) (SMG1) and in Stone Cyclone Galaxy (SMG2). (This object requires paths to move.)

object.name: Prologue Cutscene Controller
object.notes: A controller used to control the prologue cutscenes.

object.name: King Kaliente
object.notes: The boss fought at the end of the third mission of Good Egg Galaxy.

object.name: King Kaliente's Planet
object.notes: The planet where King Kaliente is fought in Good Egg Galaxy.

object.name: Octopus
object.notes: A large Octoomba-like enemy that shoots coconuts and fire balls at Mario/Luigi.

object.name: Prince Pikante
object.notes: The boss fought at the end of the first mission in Shiverburn Galaxy.

object.name: Big Piranha Plant
object.notes: A supermassive version of a Piranha Plant; used in Supermassive Galaxy.

object.name: Piranha Plant
object.notes: A standard version of a plant that tries to eat Mario/Luigi.

object.name: Yoshi-Star: Spiny Cages Planet
object.notes: The second planet used in the second mission of Yoshi-Star Galaxy.

object.name: Paragoomba
object.notes: A flying Goomba with wings. (This enemy requires paths to move)

object.name: Big Paragoomba
object.notes: A supermassive version of a Paragoomba; used in Supermassive Galaxy.

object.name: Princess Peach
object.notes: The character in a pink dress that always gets kidnapped by Bowser.

object.name: Meteor (Peach's Castle)
object.notes: A meteor used in the prologue at Peach's Castle.

object.name: Peach's Castle (Credits)
object.notes: A night-time version of Peach's Castle used in the credits.

object.name: Peach's Castle (Prologue)
object.notes: A day-time version of Peach's Castle used in the prologue; contains meteors from Bowser's attack.

object.name: Penguin
object.notes: A sassy penguin.

object.name: Coach Penguin
object.notes: The coach of the penguin class.

object.name: Penguru
object.notes: An elderly penguin character used in certain water levels.

object.name: Starbag
object.notes: A green bag-like enemy that turns invisible and runs away from Mario/Luigi; drops twenty Star Bits if defeated.

object.name: Bonus Planet Teleporter
object.notes: A teleporter that warps you to a bonus planet. The time spent on the bonus planet is defined by the obj_arg1 of this object.

object.name: Bonus Planet Teleporter (Exit Point)
object.notes: A spawn point used to define the location that the player warps to when returning from a bonus planet.

object.name: Bonus Planet (Grass)
object.notes: The grass planet used as a bonus planet.

object.name: Bonus Planet (Dirt)
object.notes: The dirt planet used as a bonus planet.

object.name: Bonus Planet Teleporter (Warp Point)
object.notes: A spawn point used to define the location that the player warps to when using a bonus planet teleporter.

object.name: Fizzlit
object.notes: A purple blop enemy that jumps around and creates a field of electricity from time to time.

object.name: Torch Fire (Red)
object.notes: A small red fire used on a torch.

object.name: Torch
object.notes: A small torch.

object.name: Ghostly: Sky Model
object.notes: The sky model used in Ghostly Galaxy.

object.name: Torch Fire (Blue)
object.notes: A small blue fire used on a torch.

object.name: Jibberjay
object.notes: An orange bird used in the gliding galaxies.

object.name: Jibberjay (Race)
object.notes: An orange bird that triggers a race mission in gliding galaxies.

object.name: Ground Pound Stump (Small)
object.notes: A small tree stump that can be ground pounded.

object.name: Ground Pound Stump (Large)
object.notes: A large tree stump that can be ground pounded. It trigger the event that is linked to its SW_A.

object.name: Puzzle Plank: Mandibug Puzzle (Piece D)
object.notes: A piece of the Mandibug puzzle used in Puzzle Plank Galaxy.

object.name: Puzzle Plank: Mandibug Puzzle (Complete)
object.notes: The completed version of the Mandibug puzzle used in Puzzle Plank Galaxy.

object.name: Collision Area (Cube)
object.notes: An area that creates invisible collision. This object ignores the AreaShapeNo setting.

object.name: 2D Restricted Area (SMG2)
object.notes: An area that, when entered, restricts movement to a 2D plane. (SMG2 variant)

object.name: Vine Sproutle
object.notes: A vine that you spin to grab hold of, and shake the Wii Remote to move on it.

object.name: Plant A
object.notes: A more advanced flower spawner which uses ShapeModelNo for all the different flowers.

object.name: Plant B
object.notes: A more advanced flower spawner which uses ShapeModelNo for all the different flowers.

object.name: Plant C
object.notes: A more advanced flower spawner which uses ShapeModelNo for all the different flowers.

object.name: Plant D
object.notes: A more advanced flower spawner which uses ShapeModelNo for all the different flowers.

object.name: Vine Sproutle (Automatic Sliding)
object.notes: A vine that can be used to reach other places in a galaxy. This one leads into one direction only and the player doesn't have to shake the Wiimote.

object.name: The Chimp (NPC)
object.notes: A blue monkey used at the end of the first mission of Fluffy Bluff Galaxy.

object.name: Restrict Power-Up Area

object.notes: This object draws an outline around models. Quite laggy, but it definitely looks cool.

object.name: Power Star
object.notes: A gold shiny Power Star that ends a mission when collected. The view from the Star Collect sequence can be changed in the rotation values.

object.name: Power Star Spawn Point
object.notes: A spawn point for a Power Star. The GroupId of this and the Power Star have to be the same.

object.name: Power Star Light
object.notes: The large light given off by a Power Star.

object.name: Before Final Bowser Cutscene Controller
object.notes: This object controls the cutscene before Mario/Luigi enters the final Bowser galaxy.

object.name: Jr.'s Fiery Flotilla: Fire Balls
object.notes: A generic map object with a model and collision. It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv). A set of fire balls used in the background of Bowser Jr.'s Fiery Flotilla.

field.name: Color Frame

field.name: Texture Frame

field.name: Shadow Length
field.notes: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.

object.name: Galaxy Fly-In Controller
object.notes:
A controller used to control the fly-in path for each mission. NOTE: Time (Obj_arg0) is input in 100ths of a second. For example, if Obj_arg0 = 300 then the time is 3 seconds.
Camera Amount: In the Camera settings for the Galaxy/Zone, you may find e:Scenario starter:XXX:XXth (but in japanese). This is the Camera for this Scenario starter. (EXAMPLE: e:Scenario starter:001:00th would be for a Scenario starter with a Camera ID of 1) This number is determined by how many XXth's there are. (EXAMPLE: if [e:Scenario starter:001:00th,e:Scenario starter:001:01th,e:Scenario starter:001:02th] were camera's, you would put the number "3" as the value for Camera Amount.)

object.name: Comet (Credits)
object.notes: A generic map object with a model and collision. It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv). A comet used on the "The End" screen of the credits.

field.name: Color Frame
field.notes: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.

field.name: Texture Frame
field.notes: If TexChange.btp exists, this will define the texture frame to be used.

field.name: Shadow Length
field.notes: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.

object.name: Starship Mario (Credits)
object.notes: A generic map object with a model and collision. It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv). Starship Mario as it appears in the credits.

field.name: Color Frame
field.notes: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.

field.name: Texture Frame
field.notes: If TexChange.btp exists, this will define the texture frame to be used.

field.name: Shadow Length
field.notes: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.

object.name: Credits Cutscene Controller
object.notes: A cutscene controller for the credits.

object.name: Credits: Sky Model
object.notes: The sky model used in the credits.

object.name: Cosmic Cove: Splashing Effect (Center)
object.notes: The center part of a splashing effect from Cosmic Cove Galaxy.

object.name: Cosmic Cove: Starting Planet
object.notes: The main planet used in Cosmic Cove Galaxy.

object.name: Cosmic Cove: Waterfall Splashing Effect
object.notes: An unused object that was once used in Cosmic Cove Galaxy. It creates the waterfall effects for the galaxy's main planet. This object is somewhat glitchy and in the final game, the splashes are part of the main model.

object.name: Starship Mario: Star List Sign
object.notes: The sign used to show the Star List on Starship Mario.

object.name: Starbit
object.notes: A small piece of a Star; a snack enjoyed by Lumas everywhere.

object.name: Starbit Crystal
object.notes: A large blue crystal that releases Star Bits when broken; used on Launch Star paths.

object.name: Starbit Crystal (Small)
object.notes: A small blue crystal that releases four Star Bits when broken; used on the Rock Mushroom route in Melty Monster Galaxy.

object.name: Starbit (Moving)
object.notes: This object creates star bits which move on a path.

object.name: Starbit Flower
object.notes: A small flower that releases one Star Bit when touched.

object.name: Starbit (Following)
object.notes: Creates a bunch of star bits, that fly around the player. Should be used on launch star paths.

object.name: Starbit Group
object.notes:
An object that either spawns a circle of starbits around itself or spawns starbits along a path assigned to it. If no path is assigned, the circle behavior will be used, otherwise, the path behavior will be used.
* Uses path_args 1 and 2 ? * Uses point_args 0 and 5 ?

object.name: Starbit Creator
object.notes: A rainbow-colored starbit which creates smaller starbits, when activated via SW_APPEAR. Providing a path is optional

object.name: Starbit Spawn
object.notes: Spawns a lot of star bits when activated.

object.name: Starbit Eruption
object.notes: Creates a bunch of star bits when activated.

object.name: Power Star Return Path
object.notes: A controller used to set the return path of Mario/Luigi after he has collected a Power Star. (This object requires paths to function.)

object.name: Mandibug Stack
object.notes: The boss fought at the end of the second mission of Honeyhive Galaxy and at the end of the first mission of Puzzle Plank Galaxy.

object.name: Mandibug
object.notes: A purple bug that charges at Mario/Luigi once it spots him.

object.name: Prologue Text Area
object.notes: An area that displays some text.

object.name: Prologue Warp Area
object.notes: An area that warps the player to a certain point.

object.name: Prologue: Starting Planet
object.notes: The planet used at the start of the prologue.

object.name: Peach's Castle: Master Luma Planet
object.notes: The planet where Young Master Luma is located during the prologue.

object.name: Scuttlebug (Hanging)
object.notes: A spider-like enemy that hangs from a web.

object.name: Used Block
object.notes: A brown used block used in several galaxies.

object.name: Used Block (2D)
object.notes: A small used block used in the prologue.

object.name: Starship Mario: Stump Platform
object.notes: A small tree stump platform used for NPCs that appear on Starship Mario.

object.name: Beach Bowl: Sky Model
object.notes: The sky model used in Beach Bowl Galaxy.

object.name: Tweester
object.notes: Moves on a path. Launches the player into the air once they get in its range. SunakazeKun objects may use two spiky rock obstacles to defend themselves. A small tornado enemy with googly eyes and a small attraction range. Can defend itself with two spiky rocks as well.

field.name: Enable rock obstacles
field.notes: Enables the two spiky rock obstacles.

field.name: Enable white color
field.notes: Starts the "White" color animation if enabled.

object.name: Deep Dark: Ghost Ship
object.notes: The ghost ship where Kamella is fought in Deep Dark Galaxy.

object.name: Sunlight Area (Cube)
object.notes: An unused area that was meant to be used in Haunty Halls Galaxy, along with TeresaRoomGlaringLight. This object is an alternate version of GlaringLightArea. Whenever a Boo enters this area, it will be killed.

object.name: Cosmic Spirit
object.notes: The dark blue Cosmic Spirit that aids the player if they die several consecutive times inside an area of a galaxy.

object.name: Launch Star
object.notes: A large orange star that launches the player from one planet to another.

object.name: Launch Star (Pink)
object.notes: A pink version of the Launch Star which appears after a Hungry Luma is fed. (except for the Hungry Lumas on SMG2's worldmap)

object.name: Butterfly (Co-Star Mode only)
object.notes: A small orange butterfly that appears in co-star mode.

object.name: Goal Gate (Surfing/Gliding)
object.notes: The large yellow gate used as the goal on the surfing levels (SMG1) and the gliding levels (SMG2).

object.name: Clockwork Ruins: Rolling Wheel Ramp
object.notes: The ramp used for the rolling wheels at the end of the first mission of Clockwork Ruins Galaxy.

object.name: Switch Area
object.notes: An area that activates the event that is assigned to its SW_A setting. You can set SW_B to make this area not be triggerable until SW_B is activated.

object.name: Upside Dizzy: Gravity Planet (Section C)
object.notes: The third section of the first planet used in Upside Dizzy Galaxy.

object.name: Flip-Out Main Planet
object.notes: The main planet of Flip-Out Galaxy, accessed through an orange pipe at the starting planet.

object.name: Flip-Out Starting Planet
object.notes: The planet used at the start of Flip-Out Galaxy.

object.name: Flip-Out Blue Walls (Middle Section)
object.notes:
A set of blue walls used in the middle section of Flip-Out Galaxy's main planet. This section combined forms a basic slight upwards staircase.
Extra notes: This object moves when it's SW_A is activated. Read obj_args for how to customize this movement.

object.name: Flip-Out Red Walls (Middle Section)
object.notes:
A set of red walls used in the middle section of Flip-Out Galaxy's main planet. This section combined forms a basic slight upwards staircase.
Extra notes: This object moves when it's SW_A is activated. Read obj_args for how to customize this movement.

object.name: Flip-Out Blue Walls (1st Section)
object.notes:
A set of blue walls used in the first section of Flip-Out Galaxy's main planet. This section combined forms two upward staircases and two wall-jump parts.
Extra notes: This object moves when it's SW_A is activated. Read obj_args for how to customize this movement.

object.name: Flip-Out Red Walls (1st Section)
object.notes:
A set of red walls used in the first section of Flip-Out Galaxy's main planet. This section combined forms two upward staircases and two wall-jump parts.
Extra notes: This object moves when it's SW_A is activated. Read obj_args for how to customize this movement.

object.name: Flip-Out Blue Walls (Starting Planet)
object.notes:
A set of blue walls used on the starting planet of Flip-Out Galaxy.
Extra notes: This object moves when it's SW_A is activated. Read obj_args for how to customize this movement.

object.name: Flip-Out Red Walls (Starting Planet)
object.notes:
A set of red walls used on the starting planet of Flip-Out Galaxy.
Extra notes: This object moves when it's SW_A is activated. Read obj_args for how to customize this movement.

object.name: Flip-Out Blue Walls (Final Section)
object.notes:
A set of blue walls used in the final section of Flip-Out Galaxy's main planet. This section combined forms two standalone blue platforms and long wall-jump part.
Extra notes: This object moves when it's SW_A is activated. Read obj_args for how to customize this movement.

object.name: Flip-Out Red Walls (Final Section)
object.notes:
A set of red walls used in the final section of Flip-Out Galaxy's main planet. This section combined forms two standalone blue platforms and long wall-jump part.
Extra notes: This object moves when it's SW_A is activated. Read obj_args for how to customize this movement.

object.name: Reverse Switch Controller
object.notes: Triggers a switch via SW_A when the event connected to its SW_B is not triggered.

object.name: Octopus Turret Barrel
object.notes: A barrel used for an Octopus Turret enemy. Can be destroyed via SW_B.

object.name: Octoomba
object.notes: (Also known as Octogoomba) A blue goomba-like enemy. In SMG1 it swings its head at Mario when he gets close. In SMG2 it spits rocks at him.

object.name: Octoguy
object.notes: A pink version of an Octoomba.

object.name: Elite Octoomba
object.notes: A green version of an Octoomba; spits two rocks instead of one.

object.name: Star Ball
object.notes: A ball with a Power Star inside.

object.name: Rolling Masterpiece: Ruler (Flipswitch Planet)
object.notes: A large ruler with a Star Ball track in the center; used on the Flipswitch planet in Rolling Masterpiece Galaxy.

object.name: Rolling Masterpiece: Flipswitch Planet
object.notes: The planet with Space Junk blocks, Flipswitch panels and colorful disks used in Rolling Masterpeice Galaxy.

object.name: Rolling Masterpiece: Wooden Platforms Planet (Section E)
object.notes: The fifth section of the wooden platforms planet used in Rolling Masterpiece Galaxy.

object.name: Rolling Masterpiece: Wooden Platforms Planet (Section A)
object.notes: The first section of the wooden platforms planet used in Rolling Masterpiece Galaxy.

object.name: Rolling Masterpiece: Wooden Platforms Planet (Comet Medal Platform)
object.notes: The wooden platform where the Comet Medal is located in Rolling Masterpiece Galaxy.

object.name: Rolling Masterpiece: Wooden Platforms Planet (Section B)
object.notes: The second section of the wooden platforms planet used in Rolling Masterpiece Galaxy.

object.name: Rolling Masterpiece: Wooden Platforms Planet (Section C)
object.notes: The third section of the wooden platforms planet used in Rolling Masterpiece Galaxy.

object.name: Rolling Masterpiece: Wooden Platforms Planet (Section D)
object.notes: The fourth section of the wooden platforms planet used in Rolling Masterpiece Galaxy.

object.name: Rolling Masterpiece: Ruler (Silver Chomp Planet)
object.notes: A large ruler with a Star Ball track in the center; used on the Silver Chomp planet in Rolling Masterpiece Galaxy.

object.name: Rolling Masterpiece: Grassy Bob-omb Planet
object.notes: The grassy planet with Bob-ombs used in the comet mission of Rolling Masterpiece Galaxy.

object.name: Starball Jumping Explanation Area (SMG2)
object.notes:
An area which shows the player how to jump with the starball while inside it.
This object has different variants for each game, this is the SMG2 variant. Look for "TamakoroJumpGuidanceCube" for the SMG1 variant.

object.name: Rolling Masterpiece: Moving Platform (Flipswitch Planet)
object.notes: A multi-colored platform used on the Flipswitch planet in Rolling Masterpiece Galaxy.

object.name: Starball Moving Explanation Area (SMG2)
object.notes:
An area which shows the player how to move with the starball while inside it.
This object has different variants for each game, this is the SMG2 variant. Look for "TamakoroMoveGuidanceCube" for the SMG1 variant.

object.name: Rolling Masterpiece: Starting Planet
object.notes: The planet used at the start of Rolling Masterpiece Galaxy.

object.name: Rolling Masterpiece: Paintbrush Planet
object.notes: The second planet used in Rolling Masterpiece Galaxy.

object.name: Rolling Masterpiece: Ruler (Wooden Platforms Planet)
object.notes: A large ruler with a Star Ball track in the center; used on the wooden platforms planet in Rolling Masterpiece Galaxy.

object.name: Rolling Masterpiece: Silver Chomp Platform
object.notes: The platform that the Silver Chomp appears on; used in Rolling Masterpiece Galaxy.

object.name: Rolling Masterpiece: Silver Chomp Planet
object.notes: The planet where the Silver Chomp is fought in Rolling Masterpiece Galaxy.

object.name: Octoboo
object.notes: An undead version of an Octoomba that moves on a path.

object.name: Octoboo Group
object.notes: A group of Octoboos that move on a path.

object.name: Boo
object.notes: A ghost enemy that can only be defeated by a bright light.

object.name: Big Boo
object.notes: A large version of a Boo.

object.name: Boo Chief
object.notes: A chief version of a Boo. Requires a AppearPowerStarObj setup, otherwise it will crash the game.

object.name: Ghostly: Candlestick
object.notes: A small candlestick used in Ghostly Galaxy.

object.name: Ghostly: Broken Ceiling Part
object.notes: A broken part of the ghost mansion's ceiling. Can be destroyed with a stomp attack.

object.name: Boo Picture
object.notes: A picture of a Boo.

object.name: Deep Dark: Light Beam (Boo Box Planet)
object.notes: A beam of light that can defeat Boos; used on the Boo box planet in Deep Dark Galaxy.

object.name: Boo (Underwater)
object.notes: A underwater version of a Boo.

object.name: Sky Station: Three Mini Planets
object.notes: The three small planets from Sky Station Galaxy.

object.name: Luma
object.notes: A small star-shaped NPC that loves Star Bits. It can have a path for follow a path (obviously) like in Sky Station Galaxy.

object.name: Master Luma
object.notes: The silver baby Luma that grants Mario/Luigi the spin ability.

object.name: Big Luma
object.notes: A supermassive version of a Luma; used in Supermassive Galaxy.

object.name: Comet Medal
object.notes: A octagonal-shaped medal with a picture of a comet on it. Used to make Prankster Comets appear.

object.name: Hungry Luma (Coins)
object.notes: A pink Luma that is hungry for gold coins. The number of coins it wants is defined by obj_arg1. Should be grouped with SuperSpinDriverPink using GroupId.

object.name: Hungry Luma (Starship Mario)
object.notes: A pink Luma that is hungry for Star Bits; used on Starship Mario.

object.name: Luma (Moving)
object.notes: A Luma that can move on a path. It can't be talked to.

object.name: Hungry Luma Feeding Explanation Area (Cube)
object.notes: An area which shows the player how to feed the hungy Luma with starbits. This object ignores the AreaShapeNo setting.

object.name: Luma Shop
object.notes: A blue Luma that can transform on the spot into either a Life Mushroom or a 1-Up Mushroom for 30 starbits.

object.name: Luma Shop (Chance Cubes)
object.notes: A Luma that sells chance cubes to Mario/Luigi for the cost defined in obj_arg0 and the currency defined in obj_arg7 (coins or Star Bits).

object.name: Plus Clock
object.notes: A stopwatch that adds the number of seconds defined in obj_arg0 to the timer. This object requires a "CometLimitTimer" to work.

object.name: ?-Block (Timed Coins)
object.notes: A block that can give up to ten coins; disappears a few seconds after being hit once.

object.name: Flipsville: Gravity-Changing Planet
object.notes: The gravity-changing planet used in the second mission of Flipsville Galaxy.

object.name: Flipsville: Gravity-Changing Planet (Back Wall)
object.notes: The back wall of the gravity-changing planet used in the second mission of Flipsville Galaxy.

object.name: ?-Block (Timed Starbits)
object.notes: A block that can give up to ten Star Bits; disappears a few seconds after being hit once.

object.name: Timer Switch
object.notes: A timed switch that can activate something via an SW_A switch. (This object requires an SW_B switch to be activated.)

object.name: Spiky Topman Spawner
object.notes: A spawner for a Spiky Topman. Already existed in SMG1, but was first used in SMG2.

object.name: Bowling Pin
object.notes: A bowling pin that can be defeated as Rock Mario (Rock Luigi).

object.name: Bowling Challenge: Foul Area
object.notes: An area that, when entered, results in a foul during The Chimp's bowling challenge.

object.name: The Chimp (Bowling Challenge)
object.notes: The Chimp used for the bowling challenge in Melty Monster Galaxy.

object.name: Bowling Challenge: Score Controller
object.notes: A controller used to control the score in the bowling challenge.

object.name: Spiny
object.notes: A red-shelled enemy with spikes on its back.

object.name: Spiny Hermit
object.notes: A white-shelled enemy with spikes on its back. Intended for 3D areas.

object.name: Spiny Hermit (2D)
object.notes: A white-shelled enemy with spikes on its back. Intended for 2D areas.

object.name: Torpedo Ted
object.notes: A gray torpedo-like enemy (named "Ted") that follows Mario/Luigi.

field.name: Homing Activation Range
field.notes: Default 2000.

field.name: Turn Speed Multiplier
field.notes: Default 1.

field.name: Bullet Count
field.notes: Default 1.

field.name: Launch Delay
field.notes: Default 180.

field.name: Bullet Lifetime
field.notes: Default 600.

field.name: Binder Activation delay
field.notes: Default 35.

object.name: 2D Movement Area (Cylinder)
object.notes: An area that, when entered, restricts movement to a 2D plane. It is intended for cylindrical-shaped planets. This object ignores the AreaShapeNo setting.

object.name: Starship Transformation Cutscene Controller
object.notes: A cutscene controller for the Starship's transformation.

object.name: Vine Swing
object.notes: A swing made from vines that Mario/Luigi can swing across.

object.name: Cracked Treasure Chest (Empty)
object.notes: A gray treasure chest that, when opened, reveals nothing.

object.name: Cracked Treasure Chest (1-Up Mushroom)
object.notes: A gray treasure chest that, when opened, reveals a 1-Up Mushroom.

object.name: Treasure Chest (Empty)
object.notes: A brown treasure chest that, when opened, reveals nothing.

object.name: Golden Treasure Chest (Empty)
object.notes: A gold treasure chest that, when opened, reveals nothing.

object.name: Treasure Chest (1-Up Mushroom)
object.notes: A brown treasure chest that, when opened, reveals a 1-Up Mushroom.

object.name: Coin Spot
object.notes: A golden spot on the ground that reveals a coin when it is hit with a Star Bit.

object.name: Chompworks: Moving Platform (Spring Tower Planet)
object.notes: A gray moving platform used on the spring tower planet in Chompworks Galaxy. (This object requires a path to move.)

object.name: Fluffy Bluff: Wooden Rotating Gear (Cloud Tower Planet)
object.notes: A rotating wooden gear used on the cloud tower planet in Fluffy Bluff Galaxy.

object.name: Chompworks: Metal Rotating Gear (Spring Tower Planet)
object.notes: A rotating metal gear used on the spring tower planet in Chompworks Galaxy.

object.name: Chompworks: Spring Tower Planet
object.notes: The spring tower planet used in the second mission of Chompworks Galaxy.

object.name: Star Bunny (Trick)
object.notes: A bunny that tricks the player while they try to catch it.

object.name: Starshine Beach: Pianta Beach Planet
object.notes: The sandy beach planet used in Starshine Beach.

object.name: Bomp
object.notes: A stone that pushes any objects in front of it.

object.name: Rolling Masterpiece: Paint Tubes (Version A)
object.notes: A generic map object with a model and collision. It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv). A set of paint tubes used in the background of Rolling Masterpiece Galaxy.

field.name: Color Frame
field.notes: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.

field.name: Texture Frame
field.notes: If TexChange.btp exists, this will define the texture frame to be used.

field.name: Shadow Length
field.notes: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.

object.name: Rolling Masterpiece: Paint Tubes (Version B)
object.notes: A generic map object with a model and collision. It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv). A set of paint tubes used in the background of Rolling Masterpiece Galaxy.

field.name: Color Frame
field.notes: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.

field.name: Texture Frame
field.notes: If TexChange.btp exists, this will define the texture frame to be used.

field.name: Shadow Length
field.notes: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.

object.name: Slide Contoller
object.notes: A controller that controls the sliding sections in Tall Trunk Galaxy and Freezy Flake Galaxy. It draws an invisible pipe around a set path which is used as the gravity for the slide.

object.name: Slide Coin Controller
object.notes: A controller that controls the coin lines that appear during slide sections.

object.name: Slide Purple Coin Controller
object.notes: A controller that controls the Purple Coin lines that appear during slide sections.

object.name: Freezy Flake: Snow Slide
object.notes: The snowy slide used in the first mission of Freezy Flake Galaxy.

object.name: Tall Trunk: Wood Slide
object.notes: The wooden slide used in the second mission of Tall Trunk Galaxy.

object.name: Spiky Plant (Slider)
object.notes: A spiky plant for slides.

object.name: Spiny (Slide)
object.notes: A spiny enemy intended for slides.

object.name: Tall Trunk: Slide Goal Planet
object.notes: The planet used at the end of the slide in Tall Trunk Galaxy.

object.name: Wiggler (Slide)
object.notes: A Wiggler intended for use on the wooden slide in Tall Trunk Galaxy.

object.name: TubeSliderJumpStep
object.notes: This object was supposed to be used for slider levels. The model file is absent, so it doesn't work.

object.name: Tall Trunk: Slide Start Planet
object.notes: The planet where the wooden slide starts in Tall Trunk Galaxy.

object.name: Galactic Tornado
object.notes: Moves on a path. Launches the player into the air once they get in its range. SunakazeKun objects may use two spiky rock obstacles to defend themselves. A large tornado enemy with a wide attraction range.

field.name: Enable white color
field.notes: Starts the "White" color animation if enabled.

object.name: Slim Galactic Tornado
object.notes: Moves on a path. Launches the player into the air once they get in its range. SunakazeKun objects may use two spiky rock obstacles to defend themselves. A slim tornado enemy with a somewhat wide attraction range.

field.name: Enable white color
field.notes: Starts the "White" color animation if enabled.

object.name: Digga-Leg
object.notes: The boss fought at the end of the first mission of Spin-Dig Galaxy.

object.name: Digga-Leg Planet
object.notes: The planet where Digga-Leg is fought in Spin-Dig Galaxy.

object.name: Starshroom
object.notes: A spaceship in the shape of a Toad head; created by the Lumas. Available in different colors.

object.name: Sky Station: Starting Planet
object.notes: The planet used at the start of Sky Station Galaxy.

object.name: Sky Station: Wooden Cover (Starting Planet)
object.notes: A wooden cover used on the top of the starting planet in Sky Station Galaxy.

object.name: Sky Station: Chomp Paths (Starting Planet)
object.notes: The marked paths for the Chain Chomps used on the starting planet of Sky Station Galaxy.

object.name: Magmaargh
object.notes: A large lava enemy that tries to eat the player.

object.name: Magmaw
object.notes: A smaller version of a Magmaargh.

object.name: Slimy Spring: Starting Planet
object.notes: The planet used at the start of Slimy Spring Galaxy.

object.name: Slimy Spring: Underwater Caves Planet
object.notes: The second planet used in Slimy Spring Galaxy.

object.name: Fiery Flotilla: Starry Atmosphere
object.notes: Decorative atmosphere that is meant to be placed around a planet or section. A starry atmosphere from Fiery Flotilla's boss fight.

field.name: Range
field.notes: Active distance from player's position.

field.name: Hide during intro
field.notes: The air won't appear during the into if enabled.

field.name: Always active?
field.notes: Always active if enabled.

object.name: Sea Urchin
object.notes: A purple Urchin with spikes on its body; intended for water areas.

object.name: Sea Urchin (Land)
object.notes: A red Urchin with spikes on its body; intended for land areas.

object.name: Sea Urchin (Shoal)
object.notes:
A purple Urchin with spikes on its body. It doesn't create any water splash particles when it moves.
By Aurum.

object.name: View Group Controller Area (SMG2)
object.notes: When the player enters this area, all the objects with a ViewGroupId equal to this area's obj_arg0 property are forced to show up. (SMG2 variant)

object.name: Boss Blitz: Sky Model
object.notes: The sky model used in Boss Blitz Galaxy.

object.name: Melty Molten: Sky Model
object.notes: The sky model used in Melty Molten Galaxy

object.name: Grand World Map Atmosphere
object.notes: Decorative atmosphere that is meant to be placed around a planet or section. The sky model used on the Grand World Map.

field.name: Range
field.notes: Active distance from player's position.

field.name: Hide during intro
field.notes: The air won't appear during the into if enabled.

field.name: Always active?
field.notes: Always active if enabled.

object.name: Jr.'s Boom Bunker: Hammer Bros. Planet
object.notes: The second planet used in Bowser Jr.'s Boom Bunker.

object.name: Thunderstorm Atmosphere
object.notes: The thunderstorm atmosphere used during Giga-Lakitu battle in Yoshi Star Galaxy.

object.name: Rollodillo Planet
object.notes: The planet where Rollodillo is fought in Boulder Bowl Galaxy.

object.name: Bowser's Galaxy Generator: Sky Model
object.notes: The sky model used in Bowser's Galaxy Generator.

object.name: Prince Pikante Planet
object.notes: The planet where Prince Pikante is fought in Shiverburn Galaxy.

object.name: Prince Pikante Planet: Fence
object.notes: The fence that surrounds the Prince Pikante planet in Shiverburn Galaxy.

object.name: Prince Pikante Planet: Ice Layer
object.notes: The ice layer used on the Prince Pikante planet in Shiverburn Galaxy.

object.name: Prince Pikante Planet: Lava Layer
object.notes: The lava layer used on the Prince Pikante planet in Shiverburn Galaxy.

object.name: Chompworks: Starting Planet
object.notes: The planet used at the start of Chompworks Galaxy.

object.name: Chompworks: Seesaw Platform (Flip-Swap Planet)
object.notes: The green seesaw-like platform used on the Flip-Swap planet in Chompworks Galaxy.

object.name: Chompworks: Lava Chomps Planet
object.notes: The second planet used in Chompworks Galaxy.

object.name: Chompworks: Side Platforms (Lava Chomps Planet)
object.notes: The solid blue platforms used on the lava Chomps planet in Chompworks Galaxy.

object.name: Chompworks: Chain Chomp Goal
object.notes: The hole used as the goal for Chain Chomps in Chompworks Galaxy.

object.name: Chompworks: Uplift Platform
object.notes:
A blue platform that follows the assigned path when an SW_A matching it's SW_B gets activated and stops once it's deactivated. Has hardcoded(?) lava particles that display when rising and falling.
Advanced notes: - This object requires very specific timing to work correctly. Used in combination with a HipDropTimerSwitch (or another object that behaves like it), this object requires that the TimerSwitch object triggering it has an obj_arg0 (Time) of EXACTLY the amount of time it takes the platform to complete it's assigned path. - If the TimerSwitch time is longer than the time the platform runs its path, the platform will loop over it's path until the TimerSwitch time ends, which will then stop the platform ANYWHERE it is on the path when it happens, the platform will NOT fall back down or complete the path, it will simply stop where it is, even in the middle of the path. - If the TimerSwitch time is shorter than the time the platform runs its path, it will stop the platform anywhere on the path aswell, interrupting it from completing the path. When the platform is stuck mid-way through the path due to either scenario above, re-activating it will make it snap back to the beginning of the path to begin running through it, so the mid-way stops do not cause desyncs for where it stop between activations. - Requires specific path_args and point_args to work.

object.name: Chompworks: Sinking Platform
object.notes:
A single blue platform that sinks when Mario/Luigi stand on it. Used on the starting planet of Chompworks Galaxy.
[MapPart Arguments] MoveConditionType: Distance - How far it sinks (a negative value to make the object rising up will glitch, turning the object over instead will work) RotateSpeed: Sinking Speed - How fast it sinks RotateAngle: Return Speed - How fast it comes back to it's initial height

object.name: Chompworks: Double Sinking Platform
object.notes:
Two side-by-side blue platforms that sink together when Mario/Luigi stand on them. Used on the starting planet of Chompworks Galaxy.
[MapPart Arguments] MoveConditionType: Distance - How far it sinks (a negative value to make the object rising up will glitch, turning the object over instead will work) RotateSpeed: Sinking Speed - How fast it sinks RotateAngle: Return Speed - How fast it comes back to it's initial height

object.name: Chompworks: Narrow Sinking Platform
object.notes:
A narrow blue and green platform that sinks when Mario/Luigi stand on it. Used on the Golden Chomp planet in Chompworks Galaxy.
[MapPart Arguments] MoveConditionType: Distance - How far it sinks (a negative value to make the object rising up will glitch, turning the object over instead will work) RotateSpeed: Sinking Speed - How fast it sinks RotateAngle: Return Speed - How fast it comes back to it's initial height
